benchmark_details.name: HapticCap
benchmark_details.overview: HapticCap is the first fully human-annotated haptic-captioned dataset, containing 92,070 haptic-text pairs for user descriptions of sensory, emotional, and associative attributes of vibrations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a large multimodal dataset and task for understanding user experiences with vibration haptic signals.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: HapticCap may not encompass the full range of possible signals and user experiences, and user descriptions are only in English and geographically limited.

data.source: Collected from user studies with diverse participants in controlled lab settings.
data.annotation: Human-annotated with users providing descriptions based on sensory, emotional, and associative perspectives.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on retrieved descriptions' relevance to given haptic signals.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in metrics indicate better retrieval performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison of various models trained on combined and individual description categories.
methodology.validation: Dataset validated through user agreement scores and diversity checks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis includes a breakdown of user demographics and description variety.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User data was anonymized and consent obtained from participants.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Dataset expected to be released under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: User consent obtained prior to participation in the study.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: IRB approval was obtained for the collection and management of personal data.
